intro: Biarum tenuifolium var. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is a perennial herb that spreads through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in suitable environments.
